What I did - Created two sample hooks in .codexplus/hooks: - pre_inject_marker.py (pre-input): adds fields hooked=true and hook_note=pre-input-injected to the request body. - post_add_header.py (post-output): adds X-Hooked: 1 to non-streaming responses. - Reloaded the hook system dynamically. - Used a small harness with FastAPI TestClient and mocked curl_cffi.Session to simulate upstream. Observed results - Pre-input hook: - Posting to /responses injects the fields before LLM execution and before proxying upstream (confirmed by inspecting the actual upstream request body). - Output: - /responses status: 200 - /responses upstream body has 'hooked': True - /responses content-type: text/event-stream - /responses x-test header: ok - Post-output hook: - GET /v1/models (mocked application/json) returns with X-Hooked: 1 header present. - Output: - /v1/models status: 200 - /v1/models X-Hooked header: 1 - /v1/models body: data: ok Notes - Some existing local demo hooks in .codexplus/hooks refer to from hooks import ... which isn’t valid under our src/codex_plus layout; those log “No module named 'hooks'” and are skipped. Our loader still successfully loads new hooks defined with from codex_plus.hooks import Hook. - The hooks-restore PR branch now has the working integration; I’ve already pushed it.
